parameters.html:
<style>
body {
  margin: 0;
  height: 100vh;
  overflow: hidden;
  background: #8c96ee; /* Set background color */
  will-change: background-position; /* Hint to optimize rendering */
  position: relative; /* Ensure pseudo-element is positioned correctly */
}

body::before {
  content: "";
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  right: 0;
  bottom: 0;
  background-image: 
    url('/images/background/furniture.png'),
    url('/images/background/furniture.png');
  background-size: 96px 96px; /* Size of the image */
  background-repeat: repeat; /* Repeat the image */
  background-position: 0 0, 96px 96px; /* Offset second layer by 50% */
  animation: move-images 30s linear infinite; /* Infinite animation */
  z-index: -1; /* Place behind other content */
}

@keyframes move-images {
  0% {
    background-position: 0 0, 96px 96px;
  }
  100% {
    background-position: 96px 96px, 288px 288px; /* Move background to create seamless loop */
  }
}
</style>

parameters.text:
This Collection contains 18 codes.  While other items can also be obtained via code, these 18 are only obtained by code.

Secret Codes can be entered at Tom Nook.  Enter all 28 alpha-numeric case-sensitive characters and if done correctly, Tom Nook will give you an item.
You can only enter three codes per game load.
Some items require an external tool to generate a code.  While unaffiliated, I have had a good experience with Nookipedia's code generator.
